thread.title: New Jersey candidate quits race after book of rants surfaces
thread.title_full: New Jersey candidate quits race after book of rants surfaces

title: New Jersey candidate quits race after book of rants surfaces
text:
Updated: 12:24 p.m. Friday, Oct. 2, 2015 | Posted: 12:23 p.m. Friday, Oct. 2, 2015 New Jersey candidate quits race after book of rants surfaces Sponsored Links The Associated Press TRENTON, N.J. â€” 
A New Jersey Assembly candidate has dropped out of the race after a book he wrote surfaced that includes rants against Asians, gays, immigrants, breast-feeding moms and others. 
Republican Anthony Cappola acknowledged he wrote the book 12 years ago and said in a statement he has bowed out of the northern New Jersey race. 
Assembly Republican Leader Jon Bramnick condemned the comments and says he will try to get a candidate on the ticket before the November election. 
Cappola takes aim at numerous groups in the 223-page book titled "Outrageous!" often in paragraphs with grammatical errors. 
In one section he stereotypes Asians as bad drivers. In another, he says gay people should keep their sexual "preference" behind closed doors "like normal people do." 
Politico New Jersey first reported the news. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WHIO-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
